official_title: To establish a senior citizen consumer price index to compute the cost-of-living increase for certain benefits under the Social Security Act.
short_title: Senior Citizen Consumer Price Index Act of 1991
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Senior Citizen Consumer Price Index Act of 1991 - Directs the Bureau of Labor Statistics to prepare and publish each month a Senior Citizen Consumer Price Index indicating consumption expenditures by individuals over 62 years of age in the United States and the rate of inflation affecting such individuals. Requires the Secretary to use such Index (currently the Consumer Price Index) for computing cost of living increases for benefits under the Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance program (title II of the Social Security Act).

titles.title: Senior Citizen Consumer Price Index Act of 1991
To establish a senior citizen consumer price index to compute the cost-of-living increase for certain benefits under the Social Security Act.
